comment.body: The elements of the array are allocated and filled dynamically, but not changed throughout the code. There is no point in changing them. I guess this is the intention behind making it an array of constant strings, which seems perfectly fine to me.

pull_request.title: target/riscv: Adding register tables to make register names consiste
pull_request.body:
Motivation for the change is inconsistent output of register names in logs. 
For example:
```
...
command - wp 0x0 4
...
15627 Debug: 19313 10173 riscv.c:4757 riscv_get_register(): [riscv.cpu0] Reading tinfo from target                  
15628 Debug: 19314 10173 riscv-013.c:4233 riscv013_get_register(): [riscv.cpu0] reading register csr1956            
15629 Debug: 19315 10173 riscv-013.c:1508 register_read_direct(): [riscv.cpu0] Reading csr195
```
This problem is fixed and memory management for register names refactored.

comment.body:
Some `return`s in this function are preceded by explicit `*enabled = <value>;` whereas others rely on this initialization at the very top of the function.

For consistency, I would recommend to use the same style for all returns.

pull_request.title: target/riscv: Fix memory access when MMU is enabled and address couldn't be translated
pull_request.body:
Now:
1) If mmu is disabled, virt2phys succeeded and returns physical address 
2) If mmu is enabled, but translation fails, read/write_memory fails

Change-Id: I312309c660239014b3278cb77cadc5618de8e4de

comment.body:
Same as in the previous case - after your latest changes, now that all reg_names are dynamically allocated, shouldn't this be without `const`?

```suggestion
	char **reg_names;
```

```suggestion
		free(info->reg_names[i]);
```

comment.body: There's definitely some bug(s) when encountering sbbusyerror. I'm hacking spike to replicate the problem, and will then look into exactly what OpenOCD is/should be doing.

comment.body: Yes, now we store real address in `physical_addr` and it filled by `riscv_virt2phys` even if MMU is disabled.

repo.description: Fork of OpenOCD that has RISC-V support

comment.body: As you can see, logic of `read/write_memory` functions  was changed (assignment to `address` was removed). So, when MMU is disabled we want to perform a memory access using untraslated address, and for this we need this change.

commits.message:
Remove an extra call to kept_alive()

This incorrect extra call has been removed in upstream code already
in March 2022, see https://review.openocd.org/c/openocd/+/6836 .

Remove it from riscv-openocd as well.

Change-Id: Ie341f5578c8bfdc518adf1e4bc134919ab76f803
Signed-off-by: Jan Matyas <jan.matyas@codasip.com>

Merge pull request #944 from riscv/remove_extra_kept_alive

Remove an extra call to kept_alive()
